heading.title: BrainSpark
heading.subtitle: ⚡ Sharpen your math skills with daily problems in BrainSpark ⚡

mathDrill.title: Math Drill
mathDrill.description: Test your math skills with timed problems
mathDrill.detailedDescription: Solve a series of addition, subtraction, and multiplication problems as quickly as you can.

statistics.title: Statistics
statistics.detailedDescription: Track your progress with detailed charts and see how your math skills improve.
statistics.activities: {count, plural, one {# activity} few {# activities} many {# activities} other {# activities}}
statistics.noDrillResults: No drill results yet. Complete your first drill to see your statistics!

settings.title: Settings
settings.detailedDescription: Configure the number of problems and other preferences for your math drills.

weeklyTests.title: Weekly Tests
weeklyTests.detailedDescription: Take weekly tests to track your long-term progress and identify areas for improvement.

weeklyTestAvailable.title: Weekly test available!
weeklyTestAvailable.subtitle: You've completed {count, plural, one {# drill} other {# drills}}! Take your weekly test to track your progress.

dailyDrillPending.title: Daily Drill Pending
dailyDrillPending.subtitle: You haven't completed your math drill for today yet.

dailyDrillCompleted.title: Daily Drill Completed!
dailyDrillCompleted.subtitle: Great job! You've completed your daily drill. Come back tomorrow for a new challenge!

welcome.title: Welcome! Develop Your Brain with the Japanese Method
welcome.intro1: Welcome to the application and emphasizes that
welcome.strong1: the brain is capable of development at any age.
welcome.intro2: Professor Ryuta Kawashima's methodology is aimed at
welcome.strong2: active stimulation of the prefrontal cortex
welcome.highlight: Daily short training sessions can prevent age-related brain changes and improve mental functions.
welcome.explanation1: This proven Japanese methodology focuses on
welcome.explanationStrong1: maximum activation of the prefrontal cortex
welcome.explanation2: through simple yet effective exercises performed consistently over time.

dailyTasks.title: Daily Training: Arithmetic Problems
dailyTasks.intro1: You will solve blocks of simple arithmetic examples including addition, subtraction, and multiplication.
dailyTasks.intro3: for maximum activation of the prefrontal cortex.

weeklyTests.title: Weekly Assessment: Your Progress
weeklyTests.intro1: Comprehensive weekly assessment to measure prefrontal cortex condition and track progress.
weeklyTests.intro2: three specialized tests designed to evaluate different aspects of brain function.

counting.title: Counting Test
counting.description: Measure speed and accuracy by counting from 1 to 120 as quickly as possible.

wordMemory.title: Word Memory Test
wordMemory.description: Memorize as many words as possible from a 30-word list within 2 minutes.

stroop.title: Stroop Test
stroop.description: Name the color of the font while ignoring the word's meaning.

assessment.title: Comprehensive Brain Assessment
assessment.description: Each test evaluates different cognitive functions for a complete picture of your mental performance.

countingScreen.title: Initial Assessment: Counting Test
countingScreen.intro1: This is the first test of your initial assessment.
countingScreen.strong1: Your task is to count aloud from 1 to 120 as quickly as possible
countingScreen.intro2: button to start measuring time and
countingScreen.intro3: button when you done. Don't worry about perfect pronunciation.

stroopScreen.title: Initial Assessment: Stroop Test
stroopScreen.intro1: This is the final assessment test aimed at checking attention and reaction speed. Your task is
stroopScreen.strong1: to quickly name the COLOR of the font
stroopScreen.explanation1: If the word "RED" is written in
stroopScreen.explanation3: - name the color, not the word!

wordMemoryScreen.title: Initial Assessment: Word Memory Test
wordMemoryScreen.intro1: Your task is to memorize as many words as possible
wordMemoryScreen.intro3: . After time expires, you'll be provided with text input to record all the words you remember. Not all words may fit on the screen, so please

phase1.title: Phase 1: Memorization
phase1.description: Study the 30 words displayed in a grid. Use any memory techniques that work for you.

phase2.title: Phase 2: Recall
phase2.description: Write down all the words you remember in the provided empty fields.

tips.title: Memory Tips:
tips.group: Group words by categories (colors, objects, feelings)
tips.story: Create a story connecting multiple words
tips.visualization: Use visualization - picture the words in your mind
tips.patterns: Look for patterns or relationships between words

progressScreen.title: Track Your Progress and Achievements
progressScreen.strong1: daily results of arithmetic tasks (time spent)
progressScreen.intro3: . Progress will be displayed with visual graphs to help you track your improvement over time.

daily.title: Daily Arithmetic Results
daily.description: Track completion time for each daily math session
daily.caption: Daily completion times getting faster!

weekly.title: Weekly Test Results
weekly.description: Monitor performance across all three cognitive tests
weekly.caption: Weekly improvements across all tests

point1.strong: Just a few minutes per day
point1.desc: Even short, consistent training sessions are highly effective

point2.desc: Each result is unique - focus on your own improvement journey

point3.desc: Regular practice strengthens neural pathways over time

motivation.desc: Your brain is constantly adapting and growing stronger with each training session.

progress.srStep: Step {screen} of {total} in the onboarding process

modal.srDescription: Interactive onboarding tour to introduce you to the brain training application features and tests.

countingTest.title: Counting Test
countingTest.description: Time how long it takes you to say the numbers from 1 to 120 out loud as quickly as possible.
countingTest.finishedText: Enter the amount of time in seconds.

wordMemoryTest.title: Word Memory Test
wordMemoryTest.description1: Memorise as many words as you can in two minutes.
wordMemoryTest.description2: Now, write down as many of the words that you can remember.
wordMemoryTest.resultsDescription: You recalled {correct} out of {total, plural, one {# word} other {# words}} correctly.
wordMemoryTest.resultsSaved: Word Memory Test completed! Results saved.

stroopTest.title: The Stroop test
stroopTest.description: The Stroop test measures your ability to name colors. After clicking the "Start" button, please name the colors that the words in the table are written in. If you make an error, simply say the correct color immediately.

resetConfirm.title: Confirm Reset
resetConfirm.message: Are you sure you want to reset all your progress? This will permanently delete all drill results, weekly test data, and reset your day counter to Day 1.

dailyProblems.label: Number of Daily Problems
dailyProblems.lessThan: Number of problems cannot be less than {count}
dailyProblems.moreThan: Number of problems cannot be more than {count}

resetOnboarding.title: Onboarding
resetOnboarding.description: Restart the onboarding tutorial to see the introduction screens again.
resetOnboarding.modalText: Are you sure you want to reset the onboarding tutorial? This will allow you to see the introduction screens again on your next visit.

resetProgress.title: DangerZone
resetProgress.subtitle: Reset all your daily drills and weekly test data. This action cannot be undone.
